body:
Excellent! Thanks for doing this

Concept ACK
Concept ACK! And looking the code LGTM. IMO there is no need to be comprehensive.
nit: put these one per line so diffs are easier to see later.

+    create_block, create_coinbase, create_tx_with_script, get_legacy_sigopcount_block,

body: Since this is a new file you might want to run it file through `black` to get PEP-8 formatting. Including fixing this case of too many blank lines :-)
diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,182 @@
+#!/usr/bin/env python3
+# Copyright (c) 2015-2018 The Bitcoin Core developers
+# Distributed under the MIT software license, see the accompanying
+# file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+"""
+Templates for constructing various sorts of invalid transactions.
+
+These templates (or an iterator over all of them) can be reused in different
+contexts to test using a number of invalid transaction types.
+
+Hopefully this makes it easier to get coverage of a full variety of tx
+validation checks through different interfaces (AcceptBlock, AcceptToMemPool,
+etc.) without repeating ourselves.
+
+Invalid tx cases not covered here can be found by running:
+
+    $ diff \
+      <(grep -IREho "bad-txns[a-zA-Z-]+" src | sort -u) \
+      <(grep -IEho "bad-txns[a-zA-Z-]+" test/functional/data/invalid_txs.py | sort -u)
+
+"""
+import abc
+
+from test_framework.messages import CTransaction, CTxIn, CTxOut, COutPoint
+from test_framework import script as sc
+from test_framework.blocktools import create_tx_with_script, MAX_BLOCK_SIGOPS
+
+basic_p2sh = sc.CScript([sc.OP_HASH160, sc.hash160(sc.CScript([sc.OP_0])), sc.OP_EQUAL])
+
+MAX_P2SH_SIGOPS = 15  # See policy/policy.h.
+
+
+class BadTxTemplate:
+    """Allows simple consruction of a certain kind of invalid tx. Base class to be subclassed."""
+    __metaclass__ = abc.ABCMeta
+
+    # The expected error code given by bitcoind upon submission of the tx.
+    reject_reason = ""
+
+    # Only specified if it differs from mempool acceptance error.
+    block_reject_reason = ""
+
+    # Do we expect to be disconnected after submitting this tx?
+    expect_disconnect = False
+
+    # Is this tx considered valid when included in a block, but not for acceptance into
+    # the mempool (i.e. does it violate policy but not consensus)?
+    valid_in_block = False
+
+    def __init__(self, spend_tx=None, spend_block=None):
+        self.spend_tx = spend_block.vtx[0] if spend_block else spend_tx
+        self.spend_avail = sum(i.nValue for i in self.spend_tx.vout)
+        self.valid_txin = CTxIn(COutPoint(self.spend_tx.sha256, 0), b"", 0xffffffff)
+
+    @abc.abstractmethod
+    def get_ctx(self, *args, **kwargs):
+        """Return a CTransaction that is invalid per the subclass."""
+        pass
+
+
+class OutputMissing(BadTxTemplate):
+    reject_reason = "bad-txns-vout-empty"
+    expect_disconnect = False
+
+    def get_ctx(self):
+        tx = CTransaction()
+        tx.vin.append(self.valid_txin)
+        tx.calc_sha256()
+        return tx
+
+
+class InputMissing(BadTxTemplate):
+    reject_reason = "bad-txns-vin-empty"
+    expect_disconnect = False
+
+    def get_ctx(self):
+        tx = CTransaction()
+        tx.vout.append(CTxOut(0, sc.CScript([sc.OP_TRUE] * 100)))
+        tx.calc_sha256()
+        return tx
+
+
+

body:
Should be referenced from a test at least? :-)

Applies also to other unused classes added in this PR

+class OutputMissing(BadTxTemplate):

body: These are all accessed via [`iter_all_templates()`](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14457/files/1483640cf1f106c62c0fbe026da8d60e1992c91f#diff-61418630f672af16f132a5c0b56fb6fbR181).
